---
title: Sandbox users
---

# Sandbox users

## Overview {#overview}

Sandbox users make it possible to simulate the different situations you may encounter with your real users when you go Live.
For example, you can simulate different [account onboarding](../../topics/onboarding/index.mdx) scenarios and processes, or practice managing the [membership permissions](../../topics/accounts/memberships/index.mdx#permissions) of your accounts.

You can add, update, and endorse the identity of Sandbox users from your Dashboard and with the [Testing API](./testing-api.mdx).
You can also delete certain Sandbox users, but only with the Testing API.

Go to **Dashboard** > **Developers** > **Sandbox users** to open your list of Sandbox users.

### Adding Sandbox users {#add}

You can [add Sandbox users](#examples) with the Testing API or from your **Dashboard** > **Developers** > **Sandbox users**.

By default, you have a first Sandbox user.

However, when adding them from your Dashboard, Sandbox users aren't linked to your project.
To link them, call an [authentication URL](../using-api/authentication/guide-get-token-user.mdx#code-construct-url) while logged in as the Sandbox user.

:::caution Projects & Sandbox users 
If a Sandbox user isn't linked to your project, you can't [impersonate](../using-api/authentication/guide-impersonate.mdx) them.
Sandbox users are linked to your own access because only you can impersonate them. However, they are linked to your projects the same way as a user, only when they login to it. 
:::

### Deleting Sandbox users {#delete}

You can [delete certain Sandbox users](#examples) with the Testing API.

Note that you can **only delete Sandbox users** if you **haven't used them to simulate any operations**.
Since you can't delete a user from your Live environment, deleting from the Sandbox environment *after* the Sandbox user has simulated something would be inconsistent.

### Settings {#settings}

The following settings are required and can be [updated] for each Sandbox user:

1. First name
1. Last name
1. Birthdate
1. Nationality
1. Auto consent
    - Auto consent speeds up the development phase when turned on by automatically granted consent. This removes the need to approve consent repeatedly.

![Image of an open Sandbox user with list of settings](../../images/developers/tools/sandbox-user-settings.png)

## Access to Sandbox users {#access}

Team members who can access the Sandbox users section* can create as many Sandbox users as they need, either through the Dashboard or the Testing API
Each Sandbox user is linked to the team member who created them. If you use the Dashboard to create a Sandbox user, it’s automatically linked to your account. If you use the API, it’s linked to the token of the user who made the Sandbox user.

:::caution Dashboard roles*
The team member's Dashboard role determines whether or not they have access to the Sandbox users section.
:::

## Example mutations {#examples}

Call these mutations with a user access token.

1. [Add a Sandbox user](https://explorer.swan.io?%3D%3D&tab=test-api)
1. [Update a Sandbox user](https://explorer.swan.io?query=bXV0YXRpb24gTXlNdXRhdGlvbiB7CiAgdXBkYXRlU2FuZGJveFVzZXIoCiAgICBpbnB1dDogewogICAgICBpZDogIiRZT1VSX1NBTkRCT1hfVVNFUl9JRCIKICAgICAgZmlyc3ROYW1lOiAiRGlsbG9uIgogICAgICBsYXN0TmFtZTogIkJ5cm5lLU%%3D%3D&tab=test-api)
1. [Endorse a Sandbox user's identity](https://explorer.swan.io?%3D&tab=test-api)
1. [Delete a Sandbox user](https://explorer.swan.io?%3D%3D&tab=test-api)
